bug.author: otto-schnurr
bug.summary: Document which platforms turicreate is able to support GPU acceleration.
bug.description: It's helpful that communicates at runtime that <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/v4.1/src/unity/python/turicreate/toolkits/_mxnet_utils.py#L85>"Using GPUs is currently not supported on Mac"</denchmark-link> . However, runtime feedback can be a little late in a setup process (e.g. after working through how to install MXNet from source with CUDA support on a Mac). Could this limitation be mentioned in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/master/README.md#gpu-support>GPU documentation</denchmark-link> ? It may help some Mac enthusiasts with NVIDIA cards find this out early and avoid going down the road of trying to setup GPU support for on their Mac.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/otto-schnurr>@otto-schnurr</denchmark-link> since MXNet 1.0 works fine with NVIDIA eGPU on Mac if you build from source... won't Turi Create 4.1 work with this? Or will I have to comment that code line out then build Turi from source as well?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/helloniklas>@helloniklas</denchmark-link> Yeah, I don't know the backstory behind the toolkit error. In case it involves something more than just MXNet capability, I haven't tried to venture past it. But yes, even with a CUDA-enabled MXNet, I seem to eventually run into this toolkit error when I try to <denchmark-link:https://apple.github.io/turicreate/docs/api/generated/turicreate.config.set_num_gpus.html#turicreate.config.set_num_gpus>set_num_gpus()</denchmark-link> to 1 on my Mac.
